thread.title: Notre Dame boys earn 8-0 quarterfinal win
thread.title_full: Notre Dame boys earn 8-0 quarterfinal win

title: Notre Dame boys earn 8-0 quarterfinal win
text:
Notre Dame boys earn 8-0 quarterfinal win Andrew Legare, alegare@stargazette.com | @SGAndrewLegare 8:02 p.m. EDT October 24, 2015 Crusaders improve to 16-0 with victory over Spencer-Van Etten Buy Photo Notre Dame's Aidan Sharma and Spencer-Van Etten's Bryant Sexton battle for possession Saturday during a Section 4 Class C boys soccer quarterfinal at Brewer Memorial Stadium. (Photo: ANDREW LEGARE / Staff Photo) Buy Photo Story Highlights Nick Steed, Rocco Coulibaly and Wichael Woglom scored two goals each Alec Cutler scored less than a minute into the game and added two assists Crusaders host Trumansburg in a semifinal Wednesday 38 CONNECT 6 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The playoff version of the Elmira Notre Dame boys soccer team looks much like the regular-season version. 
Notre Dame scored less than a minute into play and cruised to an 8-0 victory over visiting Spencer-Van Etten on Saturday afternoon in a Section 4 Class C quarterfinal at Brewer Memorial Stadium. 
Nick Steed, Rocco Coulibaly and Michael Woglom scored two goals each for the Crusaders (16-0), who have now outscored opponents 149-3 this season. Alec Cutler added a goal and two assists, and Ryan Lanning netted the other goal. 
The top-seeded Crusaders were playing for the first time since a 5-0 win over Lansing in the Interscholastic Athletic Conference Large School final on Oct. 17 at Tompkins Cortland Community College. Notre Dame received a bye into the quarterfinals, while ninth-seeded Spencer-Van Etten was a 2-1 first-round winner over No. 8 Unatego. 
"I don't think we played as well today as we did against Lansing last weekend," Cutler said. "Definitely going to look to improve on that next time, and I think we have the potential to do really well this postseason. ... In the regular season, averaging nine goals puts a little pressure on you to perform, but I think if we play our game and do well, we just have to be happy with that performance." 
Notre Dame earned a home semifinal berth against fifth-seeded Trumansburg, which was a 1-0 overtime winner Saturday against fourth-seeded Tioga. The game will be played Wednesday, with a tentative start time of 3:30 p.m. The Crusaders were a 10-0 winner over Trumansburg during the regular season. 
The Crusaders earned a 12-1 victory at Spencer-Van Etten in the second game of the regular season. Notre Dame had a 21-1 edge in shots on goal in Saturday's rematch, with that lone Panthers' shot their only serious scoring push. The margin on corner kicks was 11-0. Spencer-Van Etten goalie Jake Wentworth made 12 saves on a day in which the play was in front of him most of the time. 
"Every time we step on the field, we're always trying to figure out ways to do things better so that opponents are less able to prepare for us," Notre Dame head coach Brian Adams said. "Today was good because I got to move a lot of players around. I got game experience for some of the younger kids and did it in sectionals, so that makes it nice as well. 
"I thought Spencer had a better effort definitely than they did against us in the first game. They've improved. But all in, 8-0 moving on and nobody hurt, that's the most important thing. We'll be back here on Wednesday." Buy Photo Spencer-Van Etten at Elmira Notre Dame in a Section 4 Class C boys soccer quarterfinal Oct. 24 at Brewer Memorial Stadium. Notre Dame won, 8-0.
